pullRequest.body:
- Reorder `variable`s so that related variables
  are declared on the same line;
- Use `Seminormed*`/`PseudoMetric*` for all non-primed type variables.
- Introduce `V‚ÇÅ'`/`P‚ÇÅ'` for a normed add torsor.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7886704627/job/21520445427)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7886704627/job/21520445703)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7886704627/job/21520446138)

Note in Lean 3 we wrote this as:
```lean
  [normed_field ùïú] [seminormed_add_comm_group V] [seminormed_add_comm_group V‚ÇÅ]
  [seminormed_add_comm_group V‚ÇÇ] [seminormed_add_comm_group V‚ÇÉ]
    [seminormed_add_comm_group V‚ÇÑ]
  [normed_space ùïú V] [normed_space ùïú V‚ÇÅ] [normed_space ùïú V‚ÇÇ] [normed_space ùïú V‚ÇÉ]
    [normed_space ùïú V‚ÇÑ]
  [pseudo_metric_space P] [metric_space P‚ÇÅ] [pseudo_metric_space P‚ÇÇ] [pseudo_metric_space P‚ÇÉ]
    [pseudo_metric_space P‚ÇÑ]
  [normed_add_torsor V P] [normed_add_torsor V‚ÇÅ P‚ÇÅ] [normed_add_torsor V‚ÇÇ P‚ÇÇ]
    [normed_add_torsor V‚ÇÉ P‚ÇÉ] [normed_add_torsor V‚ÇÑ P‚ÇÑ]
```
ie, keeping similar assumptions grouped. Unfortunately the line breaks were dropped by mathport
I intentionally changed from "similar typeclasses go together" to "each object is declared on a dedicated line". Do you want me to revert it?

Can we make this as `PseudoMetricSpace` and introduce a `P‚ÇÅ'` for the MetricSpace? Some of the docstrings still refer to `P‚ÇÅ`, and I think it's more symmetrical to use `P‚ÇÅ` and `P‚ÇÇ` than `P` and `P‚ÇÇ`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(AffineIsometry): weaken some Normed* to Seminormed*
